title: Adam Driver Pitched Kylo Ren â€˜Star Warsâ€™ Standalone Movie With Steven Soderbergh, but Disney Rejected Script: â€˜One of the Coolestâ€™ Projects â€˜I Had Ever Been a Part ofâ€™
description:
Adam Driver and Steven Soderbergh almost brought their own twist to a galaxy far, far away.

	In a recent sit down with AP, Driver said that over th
body:
Adam Driver and Steven Soderbergh almost brought their own twist to a galaxy far, far away.

	In a recent sit down with AP, Driver said that over the span of two years, he and Soderbergh developed a script called â€œThe Hunt for Ben Solo.â€ The film would have taken place after the events of â€œThe Rise of Skywalker,â€ and followed Driverâ€™s Kylo Ren, aka Ben Solo, on a search for redemption.


	Soderbergh roughed out the story with â€œLogan Luckyâ€ screenwriter Rebecca Blunt. Scott Z. Burns later joined to pen the script.
	

	â€œI always was interested in doing another â€˜Star Wars,â€™â€ Driver said. â€œI had been talking about doing another one since 2021. Kathleen [Kennedy] had reached out. I always said: â€˜With a great director and a great story, Iâ€™d be there in a second.â€™ I loved that character and loved playing him.â€

	Driver described the film as â€œhandmade and character-driven,â€ comparing it to 1980â€™s â€œThe Empire Strikes Back.â€ The â€œWhite Noiseâ€ star said that that film is the â€œstandardâ€ of what a â€œStar Warsâ€ movie should be.â€

	Soderbergh and Driver pitched â€œThe Hunt for Ben Soloâ€ to Kathleen Kennedy, Dave Filoni and Cary Beck at Lucasfilm, who â€œloved the idea.â€ However, when they took the script over to Disney, they were shut down.

	â€œWe presented the script to Lucasfilm. They loved the idea,â€ Driver recalled. â€œThey totally understood our angle and why we were doing it. We took it to Bob Iger and Alan Bergman, and they said no. They didnâ€™t see how Ben Solo was alive. And that was that.â€

	Lucasfilm declined to comment.

	Soderbergh told AP of the experience, â€œI really enjoyed making the movie in my head. Iâ€™m just sorry the fans wonâ€™t get to see it.â€ Driver agreed, calling the project â€œone of the coolest (expletive) scripts I had ever been a part of.â€
	

	Driver debuted as Kylo Ren in 2015â€™s â€œThe Force Awakens,â€ and reprised the role in 2017â€™s â€œThe Last Jediâ€ and 2019â€™s â€œThe Rise of Skywalker.â€

	Read Driverâ€™s entire interview with AP here.

schema.headline: Adam Driver Pitched Kylo Ren â€˜Star Warsâ€™ Standalone Movie With Steven Soderbergh, but Disney Rejected Script: â€˜One of the Coolestâ€™ Projects â€˜I Had Ever Been a Part ofâ€™

title: Ticketmaster Claims in Letter to Congress That It â€˜Does More Than Anyone to Get Tickets Into the Hands of Real Fansâ€™; NIVA and NITO Do Not Agree
description: Ticketmaster unveiled what it says are new measures to stop scalpers by barring users and ticket brokers from making multiple accounts, requiring re
body:
Ticketmaster unveiled what it says are new measures to stop scalpers by barring users and ticket brokers from making multiple accounts, requiring resellers to use taxpayer ID verification, and using AI tools for â€œfaster assessment and cancellation of bot-purchased tickets,â€ as a Federal Trade Commission lawsuit filed last month continues that accuses the platform of working with resellers to elevate prices. The letter states that â€œTicketmaster does more than anyone to fight bots and get tickets into the hands of real fans.â€
	

	The announcement was made via a lengthy letter written to the senators behind the lawsuit by the companyâ€™s executive vice president Dan Wall, obtained by Variety, with a goal to â€œincrease the percentage of tickets going to real fansâ€ by utilizing the Social Security number or taxpayer ID verification to cancel scalper accounts. Wall also said the company will not allow brokers to exceed the platformâ€™s ticket resale limits, another accusation in the lawsuit.


	Ticketmaster will also discontinue TradeDesk, a tool that allows resellers to track their ticket sales, although Live Nation denied that the tool was being used to mislead customers, as stated in the lawsuit.

	The company also denied other allegations made in the lawsuit, claiming that it does not collude with ticket resellers to elevate prices, and that it violate the Better Online Ticket Sales Act (BOTS Act), a 2016 law meant to stop bots from reselling tickets at high prices.

	Not surprisingly, independent venue and touring organizations were quick to criticize the claims made in the letter. In a statement, the National Independent Venue Assn. wrote: â€œLive Nationâ€™s â€˜actionsâ€™ on resale detailed in aÂ letter to CongressÂ are too little and too late to get back the trust of fans, artists, and stages. They apparentlyÂ got caughtÂ opening up their systems to predatory resellers, which is a betrayal of fans and artists. This looks like an attempt to clean up their devastated public image following the Federal Trade Commissionâ€™s strong BOTS Act and deceptive practices case against them. Based on that suit and this letter, we have seen clear evidence that Live Nation and Ticketmaster are in bed with scalpers, and resale platforms like StubHub and Vivid Seats benefit daily from it.
	

	â€œThe meaningful way to repair the damage done by Live Nationâ€™s alleged collusion with scalpers is for them to voluntarily cap resale tickets on their resale platform at no more than the face value of the original ticket.â€

	Also on Monday, the National Independent Talent Association, a trade group for independent U.S. managers, agents, and artists they represent, wrote, â€œTicketmaster nor any other platformÂ should engage in reselling tickets above face value.Â This practiceÂ hurtsÂ bothÂ artists andÂ their fans. We are encouraged that the FTCâ€™s efforts have already ledÂ to Ticketmaster reforming its systems by canceling multiple broker accounts and improving its effortsÂ regardingÂ BOTS sweeps.â€

	Variety will have more on the situation as it develops.

schema.headline: Ticketmaster Claims in Letter to Congress That It â€˜Does More Than Anyone to Get Tickets Into the Hands of Real Fansâ€™; NIVA and NITO Do Not Agree

title: â€˜Prison Breakâ€™ Reboot From Elgin James Ordered to Series at Hulu
description:
Hulu has greenlit a reboot of â€œPrison Break,â€ Variety has learned. 

	The project was first reported to be in the works at Hulu in December 2024 wit
body:
Hulu has greenlit a reboot of â€œPrison Break,â€ Variety has learned. 

	The project was first reported to be in the works at Hulu in December 2024 with a pilot order. The cast includes Emily Browning as Cassidy, Drake Rodger as Tommy, Lukas Gage as Jackson, Clayton Cardenas  as Michael a.k.a â€œGhost,â€ JR Bourne as Junior, Georgie Flores as Andrea, and Myles Bullock as Darius a.k.a â€œRed.â€


	As previously reported, the new show is set in the same world as the original series but will feature different characters and a new storyline. The official logline states, â€œAn ex-soldier turned corrections officer (Browning) takes a job at one of the deadliest prisons in America to prove just how far sheâ€™ll go for someone she loves.â€
	

	Elgin James serves as the writer, showrunner, and executive producer on the series in addition to directing the pilot. Dawn Olmstead executive produces along with â€œPrison Breakâ€ creator Paul Scheuring, Marty Adelstein and Neal Moritz. Olmstead, Adelstein, and Moritz were all executive producers on the original series. 20th Television, which produced the original show, is the studio. 



	

					Elgin James and Dawn Olmstead
	



	â€œPrison Breakâ€ ran for five seasons on Fox and prove to be a hit for the network. The original cast included Dominic Purcell, Wentworth Miller, Amaury Nolasco, Robert Knepper, Sarah Wayne Callies, and Rockmund Dunbar. The show also spawned a TV movie, â€œThe Final Break,â€ and a low-budget spinoff, â€œPrison Break: Proof of Innocence,â€ which was exclusively available on mobile phones. The series also inspired a video game, online webisodes, a magazine and a novel.

schema.headline: â€˜Prison Breakâ€™ Reboot From Elgin James Ordered to Series at Hulu

title: Leslie Jones Among â€˜DMVâ€™ Guest Stars This Season; Jessica Camacho Added to Recurring Cast
description: â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ alum Leslie Jones is among the guest stars set for Season 1 of CBSâ€™ new comedy â€œDMV,â€ the network announced Monday. Other gues
body:
â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ alum Leslie Jones is among the guest stars set for Season 1 of CBSâ€™ new comedy â€œDMV,â€ the network announced Monday. Other guest stars lined up include Zoe Lister-Jones (â€œSlipâ€), Chelsea Frei (â€œThe Paperâ€) and former WNBA player Renee Montgomery, while Jessica Camacho (â€œCountdownâ€) is set for a recurring role.

	â€œDMVâ€ premiered Oct. 13 and is back for its second episode tonight. The show, which airs Mondays at 8:30 p.m. ET, is a single-camera comedy set in the fictional â€œEast Hollywoodâ€ branch of the Department of Motor Vehicles â€“ where, as the logline notes, â€œemployees are making minimum wage dealing with customers who are annoyed before they even walk in the door.â€
	

	Harriet Dyer, Tim Meadows, Tony Cavalero, Molly Kearney, Alex Tarrant and Gigi Zumbado star in â€œDMV,â€ which was developed by Dana Klein and inspired by a short story fromÂ Katherine Heiny. The show has already been given a full season order of seven more episodes, bringing the total this year to 20.


	On an upcoming episode of â€œDMVâ€ Jones will play Sally, described as â€œthe energetic and proud executive assistant to the Director of the California DMV. Our characters meet Sally on their road trip to the DMV holiday party in Sacramento and Barb (Molly Kearney) and Sally are kindred spirits and share a love for all things DMV.â€ 

	Lister-Jones will guest as Dr. Jacobs, â€œthe entitled surgeon whoâ€™s finally set aside time to get their license and is not at all pleased that it is taking so long.â€ Frei plays Amber, the childhood friend of Colette (Dyer) â€œwho is now an out of touch actress who visits the DMV to get her Real ID.â€ 
	

	In her recurring role, Camacho plays Surfer Mary, â€œthe confident and carefree love interest who meets love interest Noa (Tarrant) when she is taking her driving test.â€ And Montgomery is set for a cameo.

	Jonesâ€™ new comedy special, â€œLeslie Jones: Life Part 2,â€ premieres this Friday, Oct. 24, on Peacock; Lister-Jonesâ€™ credits also include â€œBeau is Afraid,â€ while Frei (repped by Paradigm and Untitled Ent.) has also been seen in â€œPoker Face.â€ Camachoâ€™s other credits include â€œAll Rise.â€ Montgomery is co-host of â€œWomenâ€™s Sports Now,â€ a TNT basketball analyst and co-owner and vice president of the WNBAâ€™s Atlanta Dream.

	They all join previously announced guest star Randall Park (â€œFresh Off the Boatâ€), who will appear in an upcoming episode as Beau Young, manager of the rival North Hollywood DMV. 

	CBS Studios is behind â€œDMV,â€ which is exec produced by Klein, Matt Kuhn, Aaron Kaplan, Wendi Trilling and Robyn Meisinger. Trent Oâ€™Donnell executive produced and directed the pilot from a script written by Klein.

schema.headline: Leslie Jones Among â€˜DMVâ€™ Guest Stars This Season; Jessica Camacho Added to Recurring Cast

title: â€˜Hamnetâ€™ and â€˜Rental Familyâ€™ Tie for Middleburg Film Festival Audience Award
description:
For the second consecutive year, two films have shared the top prize at the Middleburg Film Festival â€” and both come from women directors.

	ChloÃ© Z
body:
For the second consecutive year, two films have shared the top prize at the Middleburg Film Festival â€” and both come from women directors.

	ChloÃ© Zhaoâ€™s emotional drama â€œHamnetâ€ and Hikariâ€™s moving crowd-pleaser â€œRental Familyâ€ won the audience award at the Virginia-based festival, which marked its 13th edition this weekend. Orlando von Einsiedelâ€™s â€œThe Cycle of Love,â€ about the romantic journey of a Delhi street artist, took home the best documentary prize, while Kaouther Ben Haniaâ€™s emotionally charged â€œThe Voice of Hind Rajabâ€ won for international feature.
	

	â€œHamnet,â€ which screened Saturday night as the festivalâ€™s Centerpiece selection, continues to be a crowd favorite following its audience prizes at the Toronto and Mill Valley film festivals. â€œRental Familyâ€ closed out Middleburg, with writer-director Hikari in attendance for the screening.


	The Middleburg Film Festival has earned a reputation as a bellwether for awards season. With the exception of the 2022 audience winner â€œDevotion,â€ every recipient of the festivalâ€™s top prize has gone on to receive at least one Academy Award nomination. Past honorees include â€œConclaveâ€ and â€œSeptember 5â€ (2023), â€œAmerican Fictionâ€ (2023), â€œBelfastâ€ (2021), â€œMinariâ€ (2020) and â€œGreen Bookâ€ (2018).

	Across the four-day weekend, the festival presented several tributes and special honors. Casting director Nina Gold received the inaugural Ensemble and Casting Award for her work on â€œJay Kelly,â€ as well as â€œHamnet,â€ which also earned Zhao the Visionary Director Award. Colin Farrell was honored with the Spotlight Actor Award following a screening of Edward Bergerâ€™s thriller â€œBallad of a Small Player,â€ while Rose Byrne received the AgnÃ¨s Varda Trailblazing Film Artist Award for her performance in Mary Bronsteinâ€™s A24 release â€œIf I Had Legs, Iâ€™d Kick You.â€
	

	Filmmaker Jon M. Chu and his longtime collaborators, cinematographer Alice Brooks and editor Myron Kerstein, were also honored with the fourth annual Variety Creative Collaborators award.

	â€œThis yearâ€™s festival has been one of our most inspiring yet,â€ said MFF founder and board chair Sheila Johnson. â€œWeâ€™re deeply appreciative of the filmmakers and studios who shared their extraordinary work with us, and to our audiences, sponsors and volunteers whose enthusiasm and support continue to make Middleburg such a special community for cinema.â€

	Following each screening, festivalgoers cast ballots for their favorite films. This yearâ€™s lineup featured 48 titles, spanning awards-season contenders, thought-provoking documentaries and acclaimed international features.

schema.headline: â€˜Hamnetâ€™ and â€˜Rental Familyâ€™ Tie for Middleburg Film Festival Audience Award

title: AI News Anchor Debuts on U.K.â€™s Channel 4 in Stunt Proving Dangers of Artificial Intelligence
description: A news special on Britainâ€™s Channel 4 titled â€œWill AI Take My Job?â€ investigated how automation is reshaping the workplace and pitting humans agains
body:
A news special on Britainâ€™s Channel 4 titled â€œWill AI Take My Job?â€ investigated how automation is reshaping the workplace and pitting humans against machines. At the end of the hour-long program, a major twist was revealed: the anchor, who narrates and appears throughout the telecast reporting from different locations, was entirely AI-generated.

	In the final moments of the special, the host says: â€œAI is going to touch everybodyâ€™s lives in the next few years. And for some, it will take their jobs. Call center workers? Customer service agents? Maybe even TV presenters like me. Because Iâ€™m not real. In a British TV first, Iâ€™m an AI presenter. Some of you might have guessed: I donâ€™t exist, I wasnâ€™t on location reporting this story. My image and voice were generated using AI.â€
	

	The hour aired Monday at 8 p.m. as part of the â€œDispatchesâ€ documentary program, which Channel 4 says is now the first British television show to feature an AI presenter. The â€œanchorâ€ was produced by AI fashion brand Seraphinne Vallora for Kalel Productions and was guided by prompts to create a realistic on-camera performance.

	â€œThe use of an AI presenter is not something we will be making a habit of at Channel 4 â€” instead our focus in news and current affairs is on premium, fact checked, duly impartial and trusted journalism â€” something AI is not capable of doing,â€ said Louisa Compton, Channel 4â€™s head of news and current affairs. â€œBut this stunt does serve as a useful reminder of just how disruptive AI has the potential to be â€” and how easy it is to hoodwink audiences with content they have no way of verifying.â€
	

	According to the state-owned network, the stunt complies with Channel 4â€™s editorial guidelines governing the ethical use of AI, as the reveal at the end is meant to make the viewer reflect on questions relating to trust and authenticity in the digital age.

	â€œWill AI Take My Job?â€ explores the findings of a Channel 4 survey of 1,000 business leaders in the U.K. According to the survey, 76% of bosses have already adopted AI for tasks previously carried out by humans, and 66% say they are â€œexcitedâ€ about the technologyâ€™s use in the workplace. 41% said AI adoption has already led to reduced recruitment at their companies, and nearly half said they expect further staff reductions in the next five years.

	Channel 4â€™s stunt follows the media firestorm surrounding Tilly Norwood, an AI-generated â€œactressâ€ that sparked backlash from actors, agencies and Hollywood unions.

	â€œTo be clear, â€˜Tilly Norwoodâ€™ is not an actor, itâ€™s a character generated by a computer program that was trained on the work of countless professional performers â€” without permission or compensation,â€ SAG-AFTRA wrote in a statement. â€œIt has no life experience to draw from, no emotion and, from what weâ€™ve seen, audiences arenâ€™t interested in watching computer-generated content untethered from the human experience. It doesnâ€™t solve any â€˜problemâ€™ â€” it creates the problem of using stolen performances to put actors out of work, jeopardizing performer livelihoods and devaluing human artistry.â€

schema.headline: AI News Anchor Debuts on U.K.â€™s Channel 4 in Stunt Proving Dangers of Artificial Intelligence

title: â€˜The Voiceâ€™ Sets Joe Walsh, Zac Brown as Season 28 Mega Mentors
description:
â€œThe Voiceâ€ Season 28 has brought on Rock & Roll Hall of Famer Joe Walsh and Grammy winner Zac Brown as the new mega mentors for the esason. 

	Brow
body:
â€œThe Voiceâ€ Season 28 has brought on Rock & Roll Hall of Famer Joe Walsh and Grammy winner Zac Brown as the new mega mentors for the esason. 

	Brown, the leader of the Zac Brown Band, will make his â€œVoiceâ€ debut alongside coaches Michael BublÃ© and Snoop Dogg. Walsh will team with coaches Niall Horan and Reba McEntire. Both enter the season as the remaining artists prepare for the Knockouts, which begin on Oct. 27. 


	Walsh is known for his time as a member of The Eagles, as well as for hits like â€œLifeâ€™s Been Good,â€ â€œRocky Mountain Way,â€ â€œLife in the Fast Lane,â€ and â€œFunk #49.â€ During his time with The Eagles, Walsh won five Grammy Awards. 
	

	Brown is a three-time Grammy winner, while the Zac Brown Band has had six consecutive albums reach the Billboard Top 10. The band has also had five consecutive albums debut at number one on the Billboard Country Albums chart. They have sold 10.8 million albums to date. 

	Each coach is entering the Knockouts with eight artists, with no saves or steals in this round of the competition. Coaches alone choose the winner from their team to advance to the Playoffs, the last round before the Live Shows.â€¯â€¯This seasonâ€™s knockouts also feature the first-ever â€œMic Dropâ€ button, given to each coach to use on an artist from their respective teams whose performance they deem worthy. Viewers at home will have the opportunity to vote for the â€œMic Dropâ€ winner among the four. The artist with the most votes is awarded a performance at The Rose Parade live on Jan. 1, 2026.â€¯â€¯

	â€œThe Voiceâ€ airs Mondays at 8 p.m. ET/PT on NBC and streams the next day on Peacock.

schema.headline: â€˜The Voiceâ€™ Sets Joe Walsh, Zac Brown as Season 28 Mega Mentors

title: â€˜The Simpsons: Treehouse of Horror XXXVIâ€™ Score Was Inspired by â€˜Jaws,â€™ John Williams and â€˜Late Night With the Devilâ€™
description: Yes, that was a â€œJawsâ€ reference in the latest â€œThe Simpsons: Treehouse of Horrorâ€ episode, and it very much riffs off John Williamsâ€™ iconic score.
body:
Yes, that was a â€œJawsâ€ reference in the latest â€œThe Simpsons: Treehouse of Horrorâ€ episode, and it very much riffs off John Williamsâ€™ iconic score. 

	Composer Kara Talve confirms â€œJawsâ€ was the main reference. Talve is no stranger to scoring â€œTreehouse of Horror,â€ the annual horror-themed episode of â€œThe Simpsons,â€ which is now in its 37th season. She is part of Bleeding Fingers Music, a collective founded over a decade ago by Hans Zimmer. Talve is on her sixth go-round with score producer Russell Emanuel.
	



	

	



	In the episode, Springfield is â€œmenaced by a mysterious murdering monster from out of the sewers, Krusty has a demonic special guest on his live Halloween special, and we are transported a thousand years into the townâ€™s poseable plastic post-apocalyptic future.â€ 


	The episode is split into three segments, the first titled â€œThe Last Days of Crisco.â€ Fatberg is the monster who draws fat from his victims and parodies â€œJaws.â€ Emanuel explains, â€œThe music to Fatberg had to be delightfully distasteful and disgusting. So we had to score disgusting.â€

	Talve adds, â€œâ€˜Jawsâ€™ was the biggest reference for Fatberg. So we got to go really John Williams, with heavy orchestral music, and we used big, over-the-top brass.â€ The duo moved around notes to create a sound that was dissonant, amplifying the disgusting effect.



	

	



	â€œClown Night with the Devilâ€ sees Krusty the Clownâ€™s show go haywire when the Devil (voiced by Idris Elba) shows up and causes chaos. Unlike the previous segment, the music veered away from orchestral sounds and leaned into synth-heavy tones. Talve points out, â€œIt references â€˜Late Night With the Devil.â€™â€ She went back to revisit the 2023 horror film by Cameron Cairnes and Colin Cairnes. Talve says, â€œWe watched it because, on the spotting call, Mike Price, the showrunner, kept referencing this demonic hum that he wanted to come out of the characters possessed by the devil.â€ When watching the film, she finally understood the rumble Price was referring to. â€œHe really wanted the music to feel like it was coming internally from the characters, rather than it being scored.â€
	

	â€œPlastic Worldâ€ leans away from horror and more into a dystopian depiction of Springfield, imagining a world covered in Buzz Cola bottles. For that segment, renowned woodwind player Pedro Eustache was brought in with his extensive arsenal of woodwinds. Talve says, â€œHe used the Wilding Horn,â€ and, in addition to that, Eustache â€” who is known for making many of his own instruments â€” brought in a pipe.

	Emanuel says, â€œHe had made this giant thing out of PVC pipe, and he was a key part of the sound of â€˜Plastic World.â€™â€

schema.headline: â€˜The Simpsons: Treehouse of Horror XXXVIâ€™ Score Was Inspired by â€˜Jaws,â€™ John Williams and â€˜Late Night With the Devilâ€™

title: RosalÃ­a Confirms New Album â€˜Luxâ€™ Will Release in November
description: The wait is over for RosalÃ­a fans. On Monday, the Spanish singer, songwriter and producer confirmed that â€œLuxâ€ â€” the follow-up to 2022â€™s â€œMotomamiâ€
body:
The wait is over for RosalÃ­a fans. On Monday, the Spanish singer, songwriter and producer confirmed that â€œLuxâ€ â€” the follow-up to 2022â€™s â€œMotomamiâ€ â€” will arrive on Nov. 7 via Columbia Records.

	The Grammy-winning artist appeared at Madridâ€™s Gran VÃ­a to reveal the official album artwork, a photograph of her in nuns attire against a baby-blue backdrop. The journey to Gran VÃ­a was captured on both TikTok and Instagram livestreams. (RosalÃ­a was driving and smoking a cigarette on the TikTok stream â€” which is against the platformâ€™s policies. It is possible that is the reason why the live stream there was cut short.) 
	

	â€œBeen waiting so long for this day, this moment, and finally, this moment has arrived,â€ RosalÃ­a said on live. Vinyl and CD editions of â€œLuxâ€ are already available for sale on her website, including a package with a limited-edition signed postcard going for $34.99. 

	Prior to the reveal, RosalÃ­a had spent weeks dropping â€œLuxâ€-related clues across social media. This past month, she tweeted, â€œLUX = LOVE.â€ 

	Earlier today, a billboard appeared in Times Square showing that â€œLuxâ€ had a supposed November release date. More recently, she shared a clip of herself listening to a symphony orchestra with a rosary between her teeth.

	RosalÃ­a also revealed in a conversation with Highsnobiety that sheâ€™s experienced personal growth during the album-making process.

	â€œIâ€™ve changed a lot, but at the same time, Iâ€™m still wrapping my head around the same things,â€ she said. â€œItâ€™s like I still have the same questions and the same desire to answer them. I still have the same love for the past and the same curiosity for the future.â€
	

	RosalÃ­aâ€™s â€œMotomamiâ€ was released in March 2022, and won album of the year at the 23rd Annual Latin Grammy Awards. The feat made her the first woman to win album of the year twice, following her win for â€œEl Mal Quererâ€ in 2019. A concept album, â€œMotomamiâ€ was produced by RosalÃ­a alongside Noah Goldstein, Michael Uzowuru, Dylan Wiggins and Pharrell Williams.

	Following the success of â€œMotomami,â€ RosalÃ­a released features alongside Bjork, Lisa from Blackpink, and Ralphie Choo. She also released a three-song collaborative EP called â€œRRâ€ in 2023 with Rauw Alejandro. The set included popular tracks like â€œBeso,â€ â€œVampiros,â€ and â€œPromesa.â€

schema.headline: RosalÃ­a Confirms New Album â€˜Luxâ€™ Will Release in November

title: Keira Knightley Says Paparazzi Shouted â€˜Whoreâ€™ at Her to Incite Violent Reactions; She Once Stood Still for Five Hours to Block Them From Getting a â€˜Valuable Shotâ€™
description: Keira Knightley recently told The Times of London that â€œI went madâ€ during the height of â€œPirates of the Caribbeanâ€ fame, as the paparazzi descended
body:
Keira Knightley recently told The Times of London that â€œI went madâ€ during the height of â€œPirates of the Caribbeanâ€ fame, as the paparazzi descended onto her life and stalked her every move.

	â€œIt was mostly â€˜whoreâ€™ [theyâ€™d shout],â€ the actor said. â€œâ€˜Slutâ€™ sometimes. Particularly if I was with someone â€” a boyfriend, my brother or my dad. They were trying to get a reaction out of them â€” provoking people into punching them, so they could sue. And that was the time the crashes started happening â€” they were forcing people off the roads, then getting even bigger money for pictures of a crashed actress or whatever. And then Britney shaved her head so it was like, â€˜Great â€” we can push them into doing something fucking crazy.â€™â€
	

	Knightley said she went into survival mode and â€œstarted wearing the same clothes every dayâ€ in order to make herself not appealing to tabloid magazines. Her clothes included â€œthree pairs of the same jeans, stripy T-shirt, boots. I gave all my other clothes away.â€


	â€œAnd then, if I was being followed, IÂ stopped walking,â€ Knightley added. â€œIâ€™d literallyÂ standÂ there. Stock still. One day, I stood there forÂ five hours. â€˜If youâ€™re still there, Iâ€™m not going. Iâ€™m not going to moveâ€™â€¦ [and then] it wasnâ€™t a valuable shot to them if it was always me in the same clothes, standing still. Thereâ€™s only so many times you can write, â€˜Ooh, sheâ€™s wearing the same clothes,â€™ with a photo of me standing still. It gets boring.â€ 

	The unwanted attention got so extreme that Knightley made the decision to quit acting and â€œmy family backed me. They said, â€˜Just fucking walk.â€™â€ She first went to London and then started taking various trains all over Europe. Knightley was never noticed.
	

	â€œI was very good,â€ she said. â€œMuseums, trainsâ€¦ no one expects to see you there. I was very scruffy, which they also wouldnâ€™t have expected. You just donâ€™t make eye contact, go a bit hunched. I kind of slithered.â€

	Knightley was 18 years old when Disneyâ€™s â€œPirates of the Caribbeanâ€ franchise launched and turned her into an international star. She told The Times last year that fame came at a â€œbig priceâ€ and she found herself â€œstalked by men.â€ To make matters worse, she was told she deserved such behavior since she was a famous actor. She added at the time: â€œIt was a brutal time to be a young woman in the public eye.â€

	Knightley can currently be seen in the Netflix original movie â€œThe Woman in Cabin 10,â€ now streaming.

schema.headline: Keira Knightley Says Paparazzi Shouted â€˜Whoreâ€™ at Her to Incite Violent Reactions; She Once Stood Still for Five Hours to Block Them From Getting a â€˜Valuable Shotâ€™

title: Tate McRae Flaunts Stage-Ready Figure In Revealing Red-Hot 'Fit
body:
Tate McRae
                          Flaunts Red-Hot Stage 'Fit ...
                          'Baby, Don't Get Greedy' ğŸ¥µ!
                      
                  
                        Published October 20, 2025 11:15 AM PDT
                                                                      |
                Updated October 20, 2025 12:31 PM PDT
                                    
      
    
      
        
              
    
    
          When you're pop superstar Tate McRae ... what happens backstage doesn't always stay backstage -- The 22-year-old got down for some BTS shots, and we copped 'em all to kick off your week.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Check it -- Tate captioned her latest cheeky post, "Meeeeee after New York showğŸ’ƒğŸ’ƒğŸ’ƒğŸ’ƒ ..." Tate commenced her "Miss Possessive Tour" in March earlier this year ... and is set to wrap things up next month.
      
    
          We'll let the photos do the talkin' -- put your "2 Hands" on our photo gallery above!

title: Diddy Files Notice of Appeal in Criminal Conviction and Sentence
description:
Diddy
                          Take That, Take That, Feds ...
                          Official
body:
Diddy
                          Take That, Take That, Feds ...
                          Officially Files to Appeal Criminal Case
                      
                  
                        Published October 20, 2025 2:59 PM PDT
                                                                      |
                Updated October 20, 2025 3:42 PM PDT
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Diddy's making good on his promise to appeal his conviction and sentence in his federal criminal case ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          According to new legal docs, filed in federal court in New York and obtained by TMZ, the notice was filed Monday and lists Alexandra A.E. Shapiro as his counsel. We're told Diddy's team will likely file their substantive brief for the appeal within 4 to 6 weeks.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          As you know ... the Bad Boy mogul was sentenced back on October 3 by Judge Arun Subramanian to serve a little over 4 years in a federal prison.
      
    
          He was convicted on 2 charges of transportation across state lines for the purpose of prostitution, AKA the Mann Act.
      

          Diddy was acquitted on the more serious counts of racketeering and sex trafficking.
      
    
          He still hasn't been assigned to a prison -- remaining at Brooklyn MDC, for now -- though Judge Subramanian did say he thinks the mogul should serve his time as close as possible to the New York City Metropolitan area.
      
    
          Diddy's attorneys asked the court to recommend to the Bureau of Prisons that Diddy be shipped off to the low-security federal correctional institution FCI Fort Dix, in New Jersey.
      
      
              
          
                          
                Diddy
              
                          
                Crime & Arrests

          "Love Is Blind" has its first baby in the house -- Lauren and Cameron Hamilton, the franchiseâ€™s golden couple, just welcomed their little bundle of joy!
      
    
          The Season 1 lovebirds -- who famously met and tied the knot on the Netflix hit â€” dropped the big news on IG Monday â€¦ posting sweet snaps of their baby boy and revealing little Ezra William Hamilton made his debut on October 1.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          They shared that Ezra arrived a bit early -- after Lauren experienced preeclampsia and a short hospital stay -- but now theyâ€™re focused on taking it slow and soaking up all the love.
      

          Along with their hospital snaps cuddling baby Ezra, the couple also shared handwritten manifestations theyâ€™d made -- wishing for him to be born strong and healthy -- plus glimpses of their first few days as brand-new parents.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Lauren and Cameron first announced they were expecting via IVF back in May ... a huge joy for fans, especially since theyâ€™d been open about years of infertility struggles.
      
    
          Congrats to the happy family!

title: Lori Loughlin Prenup Could Mean She Gets Nothing in Divorce From Mossimo
description:
Lori Loughlin
                          Original Prenup Says She Gets Nothing!!!
body:
Lori Loughlin
                          Original Prenup Says She Gets Nothing!!!
                      
                  
                        Published October 20, 2025 10:47 AM PDT
                                                                      |
                Updated October 20, 2025 2:18 PM PDT
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Lori Loughlin has separated from estranged husband Mossimo Giannulli, but if she thinks she's going to get a chunk of the fashion designer's fortune in the split, she might have to think again.
      
    
          Sources with direct knowledge tell TMZ ... a prenuptial agreement Lori signed when she married Mossimo in 1997 provides their assets are separate property. We're told it's something Mossimo insisted on before they married.
      
    
          What's more ... Mossimo was worth north of $100 million at the time. It's unclear if the prenup changed, but if it didn't, it looks like she's screwed.
      

          This could explain why Lori doesn't consider herself "single" yet, despite living separately for months. Sources with direct knowledge previously told us she's waiting to see how the separation shakes out.
      
    
          In the meantime, our sources say Lori has a terrific relationship with her daughters and has been spending quality time with them.
      
    
          The "Full House" actress is devastated by the separation because she thought Mossimo would make changes after they were released from prison -- but he didnâ€™t -- and sheâ€™s disappointed in him, according to our sources.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          As you know, the pair were sentenced to several months in prison over the 2019 "Varsity Blues" college admissions scandal. The feds accused Lori and Mossimo of paying $500,000 to college admissions fixer Rick Singer to get Olivia Jade into USC on a crew scholarship.
      
    
          Both Lori and Mossimo struck plea deals, confessing to conspiracy to commit wire and mail fraud. She got 2 months in prison, and he got 5 months.
      
    
          We reached out to Mossimo, who had no comment.

title: 'Shahs of Sunset' Star Mercedes Javid Files to Divorce Husband Tommy Feight
description:
'Shahs of Sunset'
                          Mercedes Javid Files For Divorce After 7 Years ...
body:
'Shahs of Sunset'
                          Mercedes Javid Files For Divorce After 7 Years ...
                          Wants Primary Custody of 6-Year-Old
                      
                  
                        Published October 20, 2025 12:01 PM PDT
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Mercedes "MJ" Javid says the sun has gone down on her union to Tommy Feight ... 'cause the "Shahs of Sunset" star has filed for divorce after more than seven years of marriage.
      
    
          The reality star filed the documents in Los Angeles Friday night ... and, she lists the date of separation as last Friday, October 17 -- so, it seems she didn't wait long to head over to the courthouse after the split.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          She's citing the boilerplate irreconcilable differences as the reason for the split ... and, she's asking to block the court's ability to award spousal support to herself or her estranged husband.
      

          Mercedes and Tommy married on April 21, 2018, and they share a 6-year-old child together named Shams, and MJ is asking for sole physical and legal custody ... but is open to a visitation schedule for Tommy.
      
    
          A hearing in the divorce has been scheduled for December 18.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Mercedes starred in all nine seasons of "Shahs of Sunset" ... appearing on the show from 2012 until it ended in 2021. Tommy also appeared on the show throughout the years, and the two had some well-documented ups and downs, as any couple does.
      
    
          We've reached out to Tommy for comment ... so far, no word back.
